alert.note: Alert for Creek; Nowata; Osage; Pawnee; Tulsa; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 28 at 1:10PM CST until February 28 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR VERY DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR PARTS OF NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA... The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect until 8 PM CST this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...IN Oklahoma, Osage, Washington, Nowata, Pawnee, Tulsa, and Creek counties. * WIND...Southwest winds 10 to 20 mph with gusts around 25 mph. * HUMIDITY... Minimum afternoon values between 15 and 25 percent. * TEMPERATURE.. Middle to upper 70s * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that a dangerous combination of weather conditions and dry vegetation is expected within 24 hours, favoring rapid growth and spread of any wildfires. The primary weather factors include stronger winds, lower humidities, and warmer temperatures.

area.areaDesc: Creek; Nowata; Osage; Pawnee; Tulsa; Washington
